greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that the least positive primitive root of n is larger than the value for all positive numbers smaller than n.
comment: A081889 gives the primitive roots itself. Difference from A002229, A002230: In consideration of all n having primitive roots. A002229, A002230 only primes.
formula: Numbers 1, 2, 4, p^m and 2*p^m have primitive roots for odd primes p and m >=1 natural number.
xref: Cf. A081889, A002229, A002230. Positions of records of A306252.
results.author: _Sven Simon_, Mar 30 2003
